hatch.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out
hatch.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The eggs take three days to hatch.
hatch.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if a young bird, insect etc hatches, or if it is hatched, it comes out of its egg
hatch.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: All the chicks have hatched out.
hatch.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a hole in a ship or aircraft, usually used for loading goods, or the door that covers it
hatch.translation[1].definitions[0].note: escape hatch (=a hole in an aircraft etc through which you can escape)
hatch.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a small hole in the wall, floor, or ceiling of a room, or the door that covers it
